sn55.5:4.1: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha,
sn55.5:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn55.5:4.4: “Sāriputta, they speak of a ‘factor of stream-entry’.
sn55.5:4.5: So what is a factor of stream-entry?”
sn55.5:4.6: “Sir, the factors of stream entry are associating with good people, listening to the true teaching, rational focus, and practicing in line with the teaching.”
sn55.5:4.8: For the factors of stream entry are associating with good people, listening to the true teaching, rational focus, and practicing in line with the teaching.
sn55.5:5.3: “Sir, the stream is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn55.5:5.4: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.”
sn55.5:5.6: For the stream is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn55.5:5.7: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn55.5:6.3: “Sir, anyone who possesses this noble eightfold path is called a stream-enterer, the venerable of such and such name and clan.”
sn55.5:6.5: For anyone who possesses this noble eightfold path is called a stream-enterer, the venerable of such and such name and clan.”
